name: Cat and Mosue
description:
Cat and Mouse

This game is split into two phases:

In the first phase, the mouse gets to run away and paint a path. In the second phase, the cat has to trace the path. Players take turns; alternating who paints the path first, and who traces it second. Ideally, the first player plays the mouse in odd turns, while the second player plays the mouse in even turns. After every even turn, the player wins who has traced the previous path of the mouse closer.

Be aware of the objects flying around, as they will freeze whoever bumps into it into place!

You can play with a game-pad (Left-Stick) or the arrow keys on your keyboard! Press the escape-button to quit the game!

This game was created at the Berlin Mini Jam - so within 8 hours.  The theme was "I see what you did there",  "Long forgotten"  and "That's cheating!". So there is an easy, very unsportsmanlike way to cheat, which we left in the game for you to discover!

Enjoy!

Credits:
Aixa, Gerome, Juri & Spencer
